main event: A civilian observed a flat, bright, brilliant, shiny flickering object in Brooklyn, New York for 20 minutes on August 25, 1961.
interesting points: The object appeared to have a trail behind it and was affected by wind speeds of 25-30 knots., The witness described the object as flat and similar to a silver dollar with a flickering appearance., The sighting includes a speculation that it could have been a balloon released from New York International Airport., The sighting coincided with a scheduled partial eclipse of the moon at the time., The observer was a clear-headed individual who had not consumed alcohol before the sighting.
witness description: Civilian female, age 33, manages a restaurant, seems clear-headed.
